comment.text:
In love Thai and Asian so we decided to try this place out. I was excited to go because the photos all looked amazing. Upon entering I was impressed by the interior design, it was amazing inside....And after getting our food and drinks I was also impressed by that however the service here was incredibly bad and very disappointing.

We ordered drinks as soon as we sat down and did not get them until AFTER our food was brought out. The food was brought to our table erratically and some people had their food almost ten minutes before others and the appetizer was brought after the main course. Our waitress did not check with us once on if we needed anything including another drink until it was time to pay. To me the success of a restaurant operates on the entire dining experience which includes service and the food quality but the service was nothing short of horrible. I'd love to return here in the future if there is a strong effort to improve their service but until then I won't be returning.

The food here is fresh and service was great! Our wonderful  bartender was attentive and kind. We appreciated her continuous smile. The environment was relaxed with a mix of table & chairs, semi-booths, and seating at the bar. We ordered a mango martini cocktails and all mixed well and strong!
The food was good. But when I accidentally left silverware in my to go plate, my waiter thought it was okay to open my container and remove the silverware with their bare hands.

Overrated. Overpriced. Mediocre service and foods.
We ordered appetizers, but it came out late when we were all eating our main dish. My dish comes with soup or salad and I said i want to get salad, but I got soup instead. I am not sure if because everyone was tired but the attention to details of service was off.

There are many good and decent thai restaurants around here, but since I just wanted to try it causs one of my friends mentioned it to me, so I did.

Quite disappointing. Just not going back anytime soonish.

Silom is good, I've been several times. Love the Penang curry with shrimp & steak. Love the whole snapper, their sushi is also good. Which I typically don't order sushi from anywhere but a specifically set out sushi restaurant. If I go to a Thai spot I order Thai food. But the sushi was alright, not the best but pretty good.  Best thing about Silom they gave my fav bartender, someone I knew from another restaurant I use to frequent years ago but it shut down. Was shocked to see him here. Great drinks too btw.
This was a very average sushi and Thai spot. There wasn't anything that "Wow"ed me. I got an appetizer and full meal.

Food was great my biggest issue was that we made a 9pm reservation and we did not get seated until 9:54pm. The hostess was horrible, empty tables was there for 30mins plus before someone decided to clean it and when we finally complained about the wait time to the manager he told us the hostess started 2 days ago and doesn't know how to handle the reservation 
Btw I had one night in Bangkok sushi and panang chicken curry food was great service was bad

Probably THEE BEST Thai food I've had thus far in my entire life! It was a Saturday night, about 9 or so, and the place was not crowded at all. I'm not sure if that was a usual occurrence as i was visiting from New Jersey. In any event, those who were in the restaurant enjoying their meals were well six feet from one another. 

I had a fried snapper and my lady had chicken curry but i cannot recall the specifics of it. In any event, we both enjoyed our meals here and said that this place would definitely be worth a revisit. I'm sure there are other places that serve Thai just as good or better but we do not deviate when we find good food. The ambience was definitely a plus here as well. It was sexy and intimate.

This is probably one of the BEST Thai restaurants I've been to! My husband and I tried the sushi which was so fresh, penang, and drunken noodle. It was so flavorful and delicious.  The vibe inside is also amazing and they have a bar as well. This is going to be our new go to spot!

the service was super slow although place wasn't very full. I wasn't told about certain up charges and the price on the receipt didn't match the menu. the food was OK, portions were kinda small. wouldn't go back.

Great food and service. Started with the jerky and my
Husband got coconut soup. Then I got the Silom night sushi roll and he got the massaman curry with beef. All was great and service and atmosphere too.

photos.caption: Silom roll minus the chili sauce (addedlater)

comment.text: We're visiting from Houston, where they have lots of great sushi spots, so we know sushi, and we know good sushi. But I have to say, this spot was awesome. Equally as good was the service from Timmy and all the front people. Huge thumbs up guys.

photos.caption: Waiting for my second meal from them in less than two hours.

comment.text: The salmon hibachi plate was skimpy on the salmon, veggies were wilted and old, the white rice was dry.  Had to order a bowl of their delicious spicy basil sauce, which they charged me $5, to spruce up this blahhness of a meal.  Other plates looked great, but overall overpriced! Guess it's the area we paid for.  Beware of the waitress that needed to be called back to bring our friend his change. The bartender was on point with the caipirinha's!!! Atmosphere was cool, Parking sucks!!
Checked this little hidden gem in Buckhead our first date night! And I must say the food did not disappoint. The lychee martini was 5/5 the spicy shrimp was a 5/5. Both are entrees we're delicious!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the five stars!

comment.text: Food is not good. That's all I got. Tastes like there's syrup in the rice and the chicken was badly over cooked. Wasn't a fan.

I was in Atlanta, just across the street in the JW hotel, I was lazy to go on a ride just to have dinner, so I decided to walk over and have some sushi and drinks at Silom, it didn't disappoint, the sashimi was fresh, the service was on point, and the price was fair, cheers.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for dining with us!

comment.text:
I was pretty impressed with the food and drinks from here! I used to work at the large and tall building behind the restaurant (now with the salesforce sign) and would come over to the previous sushi spot, which was also pretty good. I love that they took over and expanded the space. Plenty of seating if you want to be away from the crowd in the main part of the restaurant with the bar. 

Food: I ordered the fried gyoza for appetizers and cobra sushi roll for my entree. Both were really good! I will say that the dipping sauce for the gyoza was not good.. very water with no taste. I also tried my friends shrimp pad Thai and it was also delicious! Thai food is my weakness, but I hadn't had sushi since March before all this COVID madness began so it was time for me to put Thai aside. Service wasn't fast and the staff were taking precautions by wearing masks and ensuring each patron was seated 6 feet apart from other patrons.

Drinks: anything with Lychee is 

Parking is easy with a few spots at the front and plenty on the side and behind the restaurant.

The ambiance in this place is great! The service is AMAZING- Timmy did his thing. He is humorous and knowledgeable about the menu items and how they work together. I had "One night in Bangkok" "Dynamite" and Fresh Basil Rolls. OMG! I've eaten at several sushi restaurants in the area and none can compare. Geez! I'm currently in a euphoric state due to the freshness of the seafood and the combination of textures. 

I will definitely be back, with friends and family in tow.

Every time I come to Atlanta I have to go to this place. I want to go to Atlanta just to come here. I go for the sushi but the menu makes me want to get so much more. Only problem is not ordering the whole menu.
Delicious and fresh! The wasabi had more kick than normal but also delicious! Would absolutely get it again! Ordered delivery and it came with all the necessities.
I definitely recommend this place if you like sushi there sushi are amazing and think that they should continue with there service

From start to finish, the staff took excellent care of our party. It was my sisters birthday. They assisted me in setting the decorations for the table. The area we dined in was socially distanced. The food and drinks were SPECTACULAR . We ordered Lychee Martinis and tons of sushi rolls. Did I mention the lamb chops? The decadent lamb chops. Wow. Thank you for making her birthday so memorable!

Stopped here on a Friday evening after my initial dinner plan failed. We were sitted immediately. We started with the fried calamaries followed by Thai curry, fried rice and Pad Thai. Everyone loved their food. The Pad Thai was really hot . Stay away if you can't handle the spice.

The best sushi spot I've been to
The food was amazing the people were very nice 
I will be back

I have been looking for some good Thai food and I went to this restaurant. Very nice and clean and the food was spot on . The waitress we had was nice and very attentive to our needs food came out fresh and out. I will be going back.

I'll be honest. This restaurant came here following another restaurant that shut down. Compared to that, this place is average. I hate doing it but they're both Asian restaurants serving very similar foods and so when this one essentially took over I expected similar if not better. Their food is good. It's not bad at all but it's not amazing. Their sushi is decent. They do have some outdoor seating which is nice. The inside is very clean and spacious. I will say the service is excellent. It was never a service issue. Parking is free there is a parking lot. It's located very close to Lenox Mall and easy to get to. But I would just caution you and say the food is average and if you're expecting food equal to the restaurant that was there before you will be disappointed. It's a very nice atmosphere. Their martini was alright too. Their appetizers were pretty good including the dumplings. Again, great service, clean area, great location just three stars for the food which again was not bad at all but just not great. I was expecting more and my expectations were not met. That being said, I would come here again with friends to hang out as it does have a very nice atmosphere and I do like their appetizers.
The food was simply AMAZING! Service was wonderful, ambiance is great! Great place to eat!
I really like the food and the service .Previously I tried some thai  restaurants but this is the best.

So good! Get the pad thai! 
The sushi was delicious as well. I recommend the tuna / avacado roll

Amazing food.
Amazing service.
Great prices.
Perfect evening.

I stopped in last week to try this place out and I'm so happy I did.  Let me start by saying the interior is beautiful.  On one side of the restaurant, there are these light fixtures that remind me of being in Thailand.  They are beautiful!  On the other side, there is a beautiful mosaic and a really nice bar.  It's a full stocked bar with plenty of seats.  The ambiance has a modern mixed with a kind of old school Thailand feel.  

I started my meal off with the tom yum soup.  It was packed with amazing flavor.  Probably my most favorite of all the tom yum soups I have ever had in the states.  For my main course, I had the drunken noodles with beef.  I. Loved. It.  My husband had the massaman curry.  He ate all of it up.  He didn't spare a drop of the curry.  It was perfectly rich.  We finished the meal with the coconut cake.  I love the cake so much that I wish I could re-do my wedding just to have that as my wedding cake.  It's the best coconut cake I have EVER had.  

The service was wonderful.  Our server, Kota, was very attentive.  Not once was my water glass low and not once did we have to flag him down for anything.  He made the night that much more enjoyable. 

I think it's needless to say that I def recommend Silom. I can't wait to go back there again!  When I do, I'll be sure to take pics!

RIP Katana. I used to come eat at what used to be Katana every year for my birthday but sadly they have shut down.. 

I have been keeping up with Silom's social media posts and have been very excited to come eat here so when I finally had time to, I visited. 

I loved the way they did the interior. It was very pretty and very clean. The menu was not anything too extraordinary. My husband and I ordered the fried tofu, fried okra, the hangover roll and the lamb. I also ordered the Thai Tea cocktail. The tofu was okay, I really enjoyed the breading on the okra. The Hangover roll was alright but the lamb tasted great, especially with the sauce it came with, I believe it was a black pepper sauce. My cocktail didn't really have any Thai tea taste to it, I think the cream alcohol overpowered the tea. I was a bit disappointed with our dinner because  I didn't receive my cocktail until after all of our food came out and the server kind of disappeared on us. It was a busy night, I understand I have been a server before but we never got our waters refilled, even  right before and after getting our check when our server could see we had no water. I would return if someone invited me to and try something else but I don't think my husband and I would return for date night.

Had really good potential. The steak was extremely bland and full of fat, the chicken was decent, and the rice was okay. The sushi roll was laughable however. The decor and ambiance is the only thing going for this restaurant at the moment. I have yet to find a good sushi place in Atlanta. It seems as if every restaurant is the same. Charge $20 for a sushi roll the size of a roll of quarters...

A new stand-alone restaurant right across the street from Lenox Mall with plenty of parking.
This was one of the most disappointing meals I have had in a really long time.

To summarize, this place did not taste like authentic Thai food. Their menu is pretty limited compared to other Thai restaurants.
I'd probably stick to Rain or Thaicoon down the street.

I ordered shrimp pad Thai and my friend ordered chicken pad si ew.
When our order came out- we both noticed that his pad si ew literally looked like they scrapped up the leftovers of multiple dishes and put it on his plate. The ingredients looked grinded/chewed up. He said the broccoli wasn't cooked all the way and the noodles tasted funny.

My pad thai did not taste like pad Thai at all. It was tasty but it definitely wasn't pad Thai haha. Lots of sauce and I don't think it was the regular noodles that is usually used for pad Thai either.
It tasted somewhere along the lines of lo mein / yakisoba.

Interesting experience. I definitely won't be back for food. Maybe for their happy hour ??

The ambiance was great and the sushi was so good! This is a good place for a birthday dinner or friend get together. Our group was big but the waitress was kind and did not mess up on any of our orders

This restaurant used to be Katana until they closed and a new ownership took over providing Thai and Japanese cuisine. The interior has new touches here and there so it felt like this was my first time sitting in this restaurant. My boyfriend and I went for a late lunch on a Sunday and there were only a few tables at the time with one server. He was able to greet us and have us seated quickly. 

We started off with the seafood tomyum soup, which is a must get here! This is probably one of the best tomyum soups I've had in Atlanta, it's packed with a good amount of flavor and heat. Then, we ordered the lamb chops along with the sashimi (15 pieces) deluxe plate. The lamb chops were cooked perfectly in medium rare and marinated in a sweet sauce, we didn't even need to use the sauce that came with it. The veggies on the side helped balance off the plentiful protein we had. The sashimi plate had your typical fish- tuna, salmon, yellowtail -except the cuts were thick AND it was fresh! I could actually get full from this dish just by itself. Cocktails were good, I did not like the first one I ordered and my server noticed I wasn't drinking it. He was so sweet and switched it out for a lychee martini, which you can never go wrong with. Great service and delicious food, I plan on coming back!
I ordered pad Thai to go and it was great. The shrimp could've used more flavor though. I'm not sure it's worth the price I paid for it though I would order again.

Loved loved the sushi rolls. We also got the beef Thai fried rice which was pretty good. We went on a Friday night and it wasn't too packed, tables were also pretty well distanced. Also loved the ambience of the restaurant. Would definitely visit again

I had the greatest time tonight. Christian and Will were the absolute best. We decided to sit at the bar, and it was the best decision we made. Service was spectacular; they were extremely attentive and accommodating. I can truly say this is a sushi/Thai place that does not get enough attention. Formally Katana, I am so happy Silom Thai and Sushi has replaced this spot. The food was incredible. The drinks were on point. It is a disservice to yourself if you don't give this place a try! SO GOOD!

Decided to give it a try as 4.5 stars on Yelp is an awesome score. Sat at the bar with a buddy and the bartender was very attentive and gave some really good recommendations. The steak was really fast and the spider roll was very fresh tasting. Will definitely be coming back again.
Great sushi place! The ambiance in the inside is nice and calm. The food was good as well as the drinks
This restaurant has some of the most incredible food! Everything that came out of the kitchen was beautiful and unique. Highly recommend!
Amazing food and drinks! Staff was quick and personable!! Me and my husband will be back! One Night In Bangkok Roll was the best roll, also really enjoyed the wings :)

Our reservation was at 7:30pm. Ordered our food at 7:45pm. There were five people in our group and the food came out two plates, then 12 minutes later, another. Then 21 minutes later another one and the last one came at 8:54pm. We order spicy food and we're thirsty; however we had to flag down a different waiter to get more water and then another server 30 minutes later for more water. We asked for the manager and I get there was a language barrier being a Thai restaurant. However, we ordered the hotpot and couldn't even get bowls for the soup. Took 35minutes. And yes I started tracking the time because it was ridiculous. People were getting their food well before we were. Wish there was a zero star for what we paid for the food. No effort to try to make it right or even come back and check on us. When they brought the last plate out, I asked what took so long and the waiter (not our original waiter) said they got a huge group in on the other aide of the restaurant. Which was a flat out lie because while I was waiting for our food, I went to the bathroom and saw there were only couples seated. The large group came in while I was coming out from the bathroom and that was just before the last plate  came out to the table. Very disappointed. Have eaten here before and was great! Sadly, they don't understand the value of damage control. And then they decided to give themselves a generous tip. I called the manager over and had him remove it. We gave the server 10% , as we were not trying to be ruthless. There are so many restaurants to eat at in Atlanta. Will be going somewhere else for Thai next time.

New place...that corner has been replaced by many restaurants, none seem to survive. The marketing on the website looks fantastic but the food and drink is no bueno. We ordered:

Thai-foon
Bee's Knees
King of the Sea sushi rolls
Pad Thai
Tom Kha
Beef appetizer(I don't know the name b/c the bf ordered it)

The cocktails tasted watered down like after you finish a drink and the ice has melted and you drink the rest, that's exactly how it taste

Tom Kha soup had the most flavor out of the dishes...but the chicken wasn't flavored and overcooked...like boiled chicken

The rest of the dishes were the same, lack of flavor...very dull to the tastebuds. Thai food is usually full of flavor from a bit tart to sweet, very gingerly, and spicy. 

Overall, the value is terrible...all of that cost close to $100 for dinner

I recommend Tuk Tuk...as that's more authentic.

Was looking for a Thai restaurant while visiting ATL and Silom did not disappoint. The atmosphere is very modern with a very relaxed vibe. Every person that worked there greeted with a smile. Our waitress went over the top and was awesome! We started with a couple of appetizers (fried okra, calamari, chicken satay) and I got a Thai Tea martini. All were very delicious and would highly recommend the fried okra. For my meal I ordered the Panang Curry with shrimp at medium level of spicy. It was the perfect amount of kick to enjoy my meal. Overall I was very pleased with my food and recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area. It is a brand new location that opened in November so give it some love!

This restaurant is right across from Lenox Mall, it is so convenient and easy access. Right when I walked in, I was already impressed with the decor. It's cozy and clean. The food is very fresh and it's perfectly cooked, not over seasoned like most places. Timmy is an excellent server, he helped us narrow down our choices since there are so many to choose from. He's very really sweet and attentive. Will definitely come back!
OMG. This was one of the best stir fry we ever had. The sushi was delicious, but the steak stir fry and fried rice WERE PHENOMENAL!!!!

The service was kind of slow, it took them nearly 20 mins to bring out our drinks, but once they realized how long it was taking for our drinks the service sped up for the food. The portions of the hibachi are fairly small for the price. It was good but it's one of those places I'll go once and most likely not go again.

I went into the restaurant to have sushi and cocktails while waiting on friends. I was directed to the bar on the opposite side of the entry after sitting there for approximately 15-20 no one came to the bar. I got up and went to the other side. The bar was completely filled with plates from previous customers. After waiting 10 additional minutes, I was told to wait again oppose to them cleaning a spot for me to sit.
